field.label: Redsys Environment
field.comment: Remember not to activate the "Sandbox" mode in your production environment, otherwise unwanted sales may occur. More information on how to test is available on our pagosOnline website
field.tooltip: When the module is configured as "Sandbox" mode, the operations have no accounting effect

field.label: Number of the business
field.tooltip: The business number, also called FUC, is a number that identifies your business and must have been provided to you by your bank

field.label: Terminal number
field.tooltip: The terminal number is the number that identifies the terminal within your business and must have been provided to you by your bank

field.label: SHA-256 Encryption Key
field.comment: For testing in the Sandbox environment, you can use: sq7HjrUOBfKmC576ILgskD5srU870gJ7 or the one provided by your bank
field.tooltip: This password allows you to sign all transactions sent by the module and must have been provided by your bank. Remember to keep it in a safe place.

field.label: Order number generation method
field.comment: This option does not modify the way in which the order is identified in your Backoffice, but the order number (adapted to always occupy twelve digits) that is sent to Redsys to identify the operation
field.tooltip: Configure how the order number to be sent to Redsys to identify the transaction will be generated in the Virtual POS Administration Portal

field.label: The terminal allows extended order number
field.comment: Check this option if your terminal is configured to support extended order numbers. This is useful for stores whose number of orders may exceed the maximum twelve positions of a standard order number. Remember to ask your bank to activate this setting on your terminal before checking this option.
